Settings.Name: fullscreen
Settings.Description: Start DOSBox directly in fullscreen. Default is false.

Settings.Name: fulldouble
Settings.Description: Use double buffering in fullscreen. Default is false.

Settings.Name: fullresolution
Settings.Description: Scale the application to this size IF the output device supports hardware scaling (i.e. any output other than surface). Original is the game's default or chosen (through setup.exe or in-game menu) resolution. If original resolution is less than desktop resolution, DOSBox will switch the screen resolution to the closest match requested by the game or application. Default is original.

Settings.Name: windowresolution
Settings.Description: Scale the window to this size IF the output device supports hardware scaling (i.e. any output other than surface). Original is the game's default or chosen (through setup.exe or in-game menu) resolution. Default is original.

Settings.Name: output
Settings.Description: What to use for output. Surface does not support scaling or aspect correction. Default is surface.

Settings.Name: autolock
Settings.Description: Mouse will automatically lock, if you click on the screen. Default is false.

Settings.Name: sensitivity
Settings.Description: Mouse sensitivity. Range 1-1000. Default is 100.

Settings.Name: waitonerror
Settings.Description: Wait before closing the console if DOSBox has an error. Default is true.

Settings.Name: memsize
Settings.Description: Amount of high memory (in megabytes) available to programs. Note: DOSBox always allocates 1 MB of low memory, so the total amount of memory equals 1 MB of low memory, plus whatever is allocated for high memory. Default is 16.

Settings.Name: machine
Settings.Description: The type of machine (specifically the type of graphics hardware) DOSBox tries to emulate. Default is svga_s3.

Settings.Name: captures
Settings.Description: Directory where things like wave, midi, screenshot get captured.

Settings.Name: frameskip
Settings.Description: How many frames DOSBox skips before drawing one. Default is 0.

Settings.Name: aspect
Settings.Description: Do aspect correction. It only affects non-square pixel modes like VGA Mode 13h, which has a resolution of 320x200 pixels and is used by many DOS games (DOOM, etc). Recommended as such games were designed for 4:3 displays, and without aspect correction will look distorted and not as the developer intended. Default is false.

Settings.Name: scaler
Settings.Description: Specifies which scaler is used to enlarge and enhance low resolution modes, BEFORE any additional scaling done according to the Fullresolution and Windowresolution settings. Default is normal2x.

Settings.Name: core
Settings.Description: CPU core used in emulation. The choices result in a different efficency of DOSBox and in very rare cases have an effect on stability. Default is auto.

Settings.Name: cputype
Settings.Description: CPU Type used in emulation. auto is the fastest choice. Default is auto.

Settings.Name: cycles
Settings.Description: Amount of instructions DOSBox tries to emulate each millisecond. Set to max to automatically run as many cycles as possible. auto setting switches to max if appropriate. Default is auto.

Settings.Name: cycleup
Settings.Description: Amount of instructions DOSBox tries to emulate each millisecond. Set to max to automatically run as many cycles as possible. auto setting switches to max if appropriate. Default is auto.

Settings.Name: cycledown
Settings.Description: Amount of instructions DOSBox tries to emulate each millisecond. Set to max to automatically run as many cycles as possible. auto setting switches to max if appropriate. Default is auto.

Settings.Name: nosound
Settings.Description: Enable silent mode, sound is still emulated though.

Settings.Name: rate
Settings.Description: Mixer sample rate, setting any device's rate higher than this will probably lower their sound quality.

Settings.Name: blocksize
Settings.Description: Mixer sample rate, setting any device's rate higher than this will probably lower their sound quality.

Settings.Name: prebuffer
Settings.Description: Mixer sample rate, setting any device's rate higher than this will probably lower their sound quality.

Sections.Name: mpu401
Sections.Description: Specifies which type of MIDI Processing Unit to emulate. Default is intelligent.

Sections.Name: mididevice
Sections.Description: which MIDI interface to use. As DOSBox currently does not emulate MIDI, but instead passes it through to an interface that does give MIDI playback support, this setting tells DOSBox which interface to pass MIDI data through to. Default is default.

Sections.Name: xms
Sections.Description: Allow application programming interface called the eXtended Memory Specification. Default is true.

Sections.Name: ems
Sections.Description: Allow application programming interface called the Expanded Memory Specification. Default is true.

Sections.Name: umb
Sections.Description: Allow access to the Upper Memory Blocks . Default is true.

Sections.Name: keyboardlayout
Sections.Description: Keyboard layout setting. Default is auto.

Sections.Name: ipx
Sections.Description: Enable or disable DOSBox IPX emulation. Default is false.
